entries.femaleVariant: Welcome to "Safe and Sound." My name is Sergeant Dobs, and today I'll show you how to feel safe in your own home.
Our loyal friend Mr. Puggins has just moved into a new apartment. What should he keep in mind?
Starting with the basics, he should make sure that he has the latest NCPD-certified armored doors and blinds. Don't let your prized possessions fall into the paws of petty thieves!
But in the event any criminals do get inside your home, it's always smart to be prepared. That's why Mr. Puggins keeps a weapon in every room, always within arm's reach.
And for you folks who consider no price too high for your safety, consider installing your own home turret system to take care of even the nastiest intruders!

If you prefer the personal touch, hire a private security guard from a reputable corporation. It appears Mr. Puggins learned the hard way that any old gun-for-hire could shoot you in the back at the drop of a hat.
Also, it goes without saying, a home surveillance system is essential hardware to keep an eye out for suspicious activity.
And, of course, Mr. Puggins cannot forget the security of his local micronet. You wouldn't want to give a nefarious netrunner access to your washing machine, would you?
Last but not least – invest in a Kevlar® vest. With an added layer of protection available at all times, Mr. Puggins no longer fears the occasional stray... Bullet, that is.
Now, with everything in place, Mr. Puggins can finally sit back and relax. After all, there's no place like home!
That's all for this episode of "Safe and Sound." Stay alive out there!
